thread.title: Emma Roberts is taking this exotic print trend straight into 2017
thread.title_full: Emma Roberts is taking this exotic print trend straight into 2017

author: Olivia Harvey
title: Emma Roberts is taking this exotic print trend straight into 2017

organizations.name: nordstrom / topshop patterned jacket in leopard print
mango faux fur leopard print coat

text:
Emma Roberts is taking this exotic print trend straight into 2017 “New Year, new me” is a phrase that applies to a lot of people. But Scream Queens star, Emma Roberts, has decided to keep her old self around in 2017 — at least when it comes to her old self’s fashion. Roberts is bringing her jaguar print trend into 2017 and we’re praising her because this trend is just too good to quit .
Yesterday, Roberts posted this Instagram of herself in her jaguar jacket . She captioned the photo, “Sipping and soaking in the first few days of 2017 in my @Coach Delancey watch.” And as much as Roberts loves her Coach watch, we know she loves her jaguar coat just as much .
Sipping and soaking in the first few days of 2017 in my @Coach Delancey watch #TimeforCoach #Partner 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Jan 3, 2017 at 2:18pm PST 
We know this because she’s pictured here celebrating Christmas Eve in the same jaguar print jacket (say that five times fast). Pairing it with a denim skirt made this look nod to the 90s. Roberts’ friend, Brit Elkin, is also wearing a 90s-inspired plaid outfit…
Merry Christmas Eve everybody ❤️ @britelkin 
A photo posted by Emma Roberts (@emmaroberts) on Dec 24, 2016 at 12:13pm PST 
…but has been known to sport some jaguar print of her own.
shopping / the holidays, captured by @chrismacho 
A video posted by Brit ELKIN (@britelkin) on Dec 22, 2016 at 10:10pm PST 
Animal print — specifically leopard and jaguar — was a huge trend at the end of 2016. We were afraid we would have to put our faux furs away until they were fashionable five years from now. But, no. Thanks to fashionistas like Roberts and others, animal print is going strong in 2017 and will hopefully last throughout the rest of the winter.

Check out these badasses wearing their faux animal print proudly into the New Year. Go girls, go! Up the animal print to pair with your velvet pleated midi a la⠀ @hannahfgale's moto must-have | Shop her look with www.LIKEtoKNOW.it | http://liketk.it/2pNO6 #liketkit 
A photo posted by LIKEtoKNOW.it (@liketoknow.it) on Jan 2, 2017 at 7:51am PST 
close up #leopardprint #bimbaylola #casual 
A photo posted by Mariana (@mariana.oliveiralima) on Jan 4, 2017 at 12:18pm PST 
Sorry guys, didn't mean to turn my back on you 
A photo posted by Oe.Ló. (@confashiontime) on Jan 4, 2017 at 10:33am PST 
If you don’t already own a leopard/jaguar/cheetah print coat yet, it’s time you take the plunge! Always check your local thrift store first to not only get a great deal on a semi-expensive trend, but to also be a part of that reduce/reuse/recycle system — it’s important! But if you can’t find anything that suits your fancy and you’re willing to spend a few extra bucks, here are some great options.
Mango Faux Fur Leopard Print Coat from ASOS ($121) ASOS Topshop Leopard Print Car Coat available at Nordstrom ($79.99) Nordstrom / Topshop Patterned Jacket in Leopard Print from H&M ($39.99) H&M Because leopard and jaguar print is incredibly stylish right now, it’s not hard to find the purr-fect (we’re so sorry) jacket or faux fur coat for you.
